items.sentence: I suspect that Tom didn\'t go to Boston last week.
I suspect that Tom didn\'t really need to do that.
I suspect that Tom didn\'t really want to do that.
I suspect that Tom doesn\'t often do that anymore.
If you do it this way, you can save several hours.
In clear weather, we can see the island from here.
Is Tom really going to go to Australia by himself?
Is it OK if I leave my suitcases here for a while?
Tom tried to adjust the temperature of the shower.
Tom used to ask me so many questions about Boston.
Tom was apparently murdered while he was sleeping.
Tom was looking forward to having a few weeks off.
Tom was obviously worried about what might happen.
Copy what\'s on the blackboard into your notebook.
Could you tell Tom why you don\'t want to do that?
Don\'t be offended. Tom\'s that way with everyone.
Even if it isn\'t true, it\'s still rather clever.
Tom told us he didn\'t want to play poker with us.
This is one of the shortest books that I\'ve read.
I wish I\'d known that Tom couldn\'t speak French.
